conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas from state A to state B.
The process from state A to state B is an isobaric expansion (constant pressure).
The pressure at state A and B is constant at 1 x 10^5 Pa.
The volume changes from V_A = 3 L to V_B = 4 L.
The work done by the gas during an isobaric process is given by W = p ΔV.
ΔV = V_B - V_A = 4 L - 3 L = 1 L.
Convert the volume from liters to cubic meters: ΔV = 1 L = 0.001 m^3.
Calculate the work: W = p ΔV = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x (0.001 m^3) = 100 J.
The work done externally by the gas from state A to state B is 100 Joules.
